mods.abstract: TEN DOLLARS REWARD. RANAWAY from 169 Carondelet corner of Hevia streets, on the night of 30th of August, and was seen the next morning in Peydras street, a negro boy named CHARLES, about 17 years of age, and 5 fee or thereabouts in height, verv black, and has an impediment in his speech, one of his legs is sore, occasioned by a recent hurt; he had on when he went away a white cotton or linen shirt and white cotton pantaloons.- Masters of vessels and steam boats are cautioned against receiving or harboring said negro, as well as all other persons, as the utmost rigour of the law will be enforced against them. The above reward will be paid for dlivering him into any of the jails of either of the municipalities, or at 169 Carondelet, corner of Jevia steeet. sept
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
